intro: Schenkia australis, commonly known as the Australian sandplain lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and showy, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Schenkia australis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought.
